markdown.markdown:
An archipelago of skybound islands. 
There near perfect flat tops bely their true origin.
They are the tops of the mountains from the REDWOODS, this is evident by the foundation. Rough and tapering to the once mountain tip.

Due to the high altitudes most life struggles.
But where many struggle, few thrive.
Most of the islands are littered with Giant groundsels.
These large flowering plants are easily mistaken for small trees. The top adorned with a radial pattern of thick elliptical leaves curving up tpo the skies. Below this is a black/brown mass of these leaves, dead. This mass growing larger the closer to the top as the leaves layer on top of each other.

Due to island separation these giant groundsel differ from island to island. This also determines the birds, as their is a litany of them, that exist ion each island.

Of course where their is life there are sentient humanoids. They live a hard life on the central island. They live in houses that have been combined with birds. This allows them to leave these islands and explore the world. These created by Bab and Yaga, Grandmother and Grandson. Grandson able to build the finest and sturdiest houses. Grandmother able to combine that with birds.


(These are the tops of the mountains in the REDWOODS).

- Archipelago of sky islands
- Giant groundsel are the flora. Differ from island to island
- Each island has a bird that specialises on the specific groundsel in some manner
- Above the wind woods
- Amazonia cannot reach here as her drones cannot handle the wind
- ONe island has been stolen and is in the SANDWOODS as the major base




Bab is the Grandma of Yaga who is the grandson of Bab.

Yaga is a ginger young man. 
He is built like a log with his furry torso always on display through thick suspenders that keep his tool belt and hemp trousers aloft.
His head and face are covered in thick but finely braided hair.
Even through all this his bright eyes show he is always smiling whilst building houses or having tea with his grandma.

Many will see a hag, a crone, and a witch when their eyes feast upon Yaga.
This impression will not be softened by her manic enthusiasm for combining birds with all manner of inanimate objects.
Once you get past your preconceptions you will behold a wise kind woman gone childish with age.
She is most at peace when enthralled in her work, listening to the music from her lyrebird based gramophone, or sharing tea with her grandson.





## Minor Islands

Island ideas:
- Troll Island: An island covered in disgorged Troll
- Island of tune fork groundsells. Inhabited by ground bound Lyrebird like birds. They can play notes that cause the tune fork leaves to fall which they feed on.


Groundsell ideas:
- One that ants use a colony
- Multiple leaf rosettes from one organism that spreads around like a spider plant
- Water gorgers. These groundsels can be found on Troll island


Bird ideas, most birds are from vultures due to the high altitude:
- Troll vulture, raised by actual trolls. The trolls feed them their flesh. This has caused the vultures to become massive and they can regenerate. The trolls use them for travel. Most likely need to bargain with a troll to get one.
- 

### Gourd Island

An Island inhabited by Trolls, Troll vultures, and the Gourd Groundsels. Aside from these the only other life includes flying bugs to small to be noticed by these massive inhabitants.

When the trolls lived in the WINDWOODS they would regularly play fight with members of their community. Of course when you can perfectly regenerate (as long as there is no fire or acid involved) this leads to many lost limbs. The largest and bravest vultures capitalised on these opportunities.

However, this led the vultures to rapidly evolve into Troll vultures. Massive regenerating vultures able to carry the weight of a Troll due to the high winds of the WINDWOODS. The 2 species partnered together making there new home on Gourd Island and hunting and scavenging the surrounding lands.

Gourd Island was not just useful due to its elevation but also due to its flora. The Gourd Grounsels are engourged with all the water they can capture on the island, leaving none for any other creature. Except the Trolls and their animal companions. You will never see a troll without the gourd they strap to their backs. Used to quench the thirst of them and their vultures.

They occasionally trade one of their Troll vultures to other humanoids. This may be in exchange for a quest or for an amazing hunting weapon.
